
# DataSource with autogenerated name

|||
|:-|:-|
| Id | **RDS0006**
| Mnemo | DATASOURCE_NAME_NODEFAULT
| Severity | ⚠ Warning
| Category | [Datasource](./Group_Datasource.md)
| Source code | [DatasourceNameAutoGeneratedRule.cs](../../../Rules/ReportDatasource/DatasourceNameAutoGeneratedRule.cs)

## Cause

This rule is triggered when a DataSource has an automatically generated name.
<p id="descr">Replace the DataSource name with a more meaningful one.</p>

## Examples

Bad

```xml
<RptDataSource Name="Datasource1">
  <ConnectionProperties>
    <Extension>SQL</Extension>
    <ConnectString>Data Source=srv.domain.org;Initial Catalog=myDb;Integrated Security=SSPI</ConnectString>
  </ConnectionProperties>
</RptDataSource>
```

Good

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<RptDataSource Name="srv.myDb">
  <ConnectionProperties>
    <Extension>SQL</Extension>
    <ConnectString>Data Source=srv.domain.org;Initial Catalog=myDb;Integrated Security=SSPI</ConnectString>
  </ConnectionProperties>
</RptDataSource>
```

## Tips

💡 A DataSource name is considered automatically generated if it matches one of the following patterns (case insensitive):

- datasourceXXX
- datasource XXX
- datasource-XXX

where XXX is a sequence number.
